body:
Hi Allyson and Juliana,

If it doesn't generate a new ill file you have to do it yourself for now. You can use the shading profile from the generated .csv file to find the shading state for each hour and then use that to merge 3 .ill files into one based on shading states. [You can also load the shading profile into Grasshopper using Honeyb...](http://hydrashare.github.io/hydra/viewer?owner=mostaphaRoudsari&fork=hydra_1&id=Integrated_Daylight_and_Energy_simulation&slide=0&scale=4.713068322751456&offset=-2521.5077349854946,-1281.1625578131225).

My apologies for the wrong information. I should have checked before posting the answer here.

Mostapha
